<script>
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
  console.log("üöÄ Iniciando carruseles...");
  
  function initCarousel(containerSelector) {
    console.log(`üîç Buscando carrusel: ${containerSelector}`);
    const container = document.querySelector(containerSelector);
    
    if (!container) {
      console.error(`‚ùå No se encontr√≥ el contenedor: ${containerSelector}`);
      return;
    }
    
    const slides = container.querySelectorAll('.carousel-slide');
    const credits = container.querySelectorAll('.photo-credits');
    
    console.log(`üì∏ Slides encontrados: ${slides.length}`);
    
    if (slides.length === 0) {
      console.warn(`‚ö†Ô∏è No hay slides en: ${containerSelector}`);
      return;
    }

    let currentIndex = 0;
    let intervalId;

  
    function updateVisibility() {
      slides.forEach((slide, index) => {
        const isActive = index === currentIndex;
        slide.style.opacity = isActive ? '1' : '0';
        slide.classList.toggle('active', isActive);
        
        if (credits[index]) {
          credits[index].style.display = isActive ? 'block' : 'none';
          credits[index].classList.toggle('hidden', !isActive);
        }
      });
    }

 
    updateVisibility();

    function showNextSlide() {
      console.log("üîÑ Cambiando slide...");
      

      slides[currentIndex].style.opacity = '0';
      slides[currentIndex].classList.remove('active');
      if (credits[currentIndex]) {
        credits[currentIndex].style.display = 'none';
        credits[currentIndex].classList.add('hidden');
      }


      currentIndex = (currentIndex + 1) % slides.length;
      console.log(`üéØ Nuevo √≠ndice: ${currentIndex}`);


      slides[currentIndex].style.opacity = '1';
      slides[currentIndex].classList.add('active');
      if (credits[currentIndex]) {
        credits[currentIndex].style.display = 'block';
        credits[currentIndex].classList.remove('hidden');
      }
    }


    if (slides.length > 1) {
      console.log("‚è±Ô∏è Iniciando intervalo...");
      intervalId = setInterval(showNextSlide, 5000);

      container.addEventListener('mouseenter', () => {
        console.log("‚è∏Ô∏è Pausando carrusel");
        clearInterval(intervalId);
      });
      
      container.addEventListener('mouseleave', () => {
        console.log("‚ñ∂Ô∏è Reanudando carrusel");
        intervalId = setInterval(showNextSlide, 5000);
      });
    }
  }


  initCarousel('.homepage .carousel-container');
  initCarousel('#la-palma .carousel-container');
  initCarousel('#teide .carousel-container');
  initCarousel('#earthquakes .carousel-container');
  initCarousel('#lanzarote .carousel-container');
});
</script>




<script>
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {

  const navContainer = document.createElement('div');
  navContainer.className = 'circle-nav-container';
  
  navContainer.innerHTML = `
    <div class="circle-nav-btn" id="homepage-btn" title="Home"></div>
    <div class="circle-nav-btn" id="la-palma-btn" title="La Palma"></div>
    <div class="circle-nav-btn" id="teide-btn" title="Teide"></div>
    <div class="circle-nav-btn" id="lanzarote-btn" title="Lanzarote"></div>
    <div class="circle-nav-btn" id="earthquakes-btn" title="Earthquakes"></div>
  `;
  
  document.body.appendChild(navContainer);


  const homepageBtn = document.getElementById('homepage-btn');
  const laPalmaBtn = document.getElementById('la-palma-btn');
  const earthquakesBtn = document.getElementById('earthquakes-btn');
  const lanzaroteBtn = document.getElementById('lanzarote-btn');
  const teideBtn = document.getElementById
  ('teide-btn')

  homepageBtn.addEventListener('click', () => {
    window.location.hash = '#homepage';
    updateActiveButton('#homepage');
  });
  
  laPalmaBtn.addEventListener('click', () => {
    window.location.hash = '#la-palma';
    updateActiveButton('#la-palma');
  });

  lanzaroteBtn.addEventListener('click', () => {
    window.location.hash = '#lanzarote';
    updateActiveButton('#lanzarote');
  });

  teideBtn.addEventListener('click', () => {
    window.location.hash = '#teide';
    updateActiveButton('#teide');
  });

  earthquakesBtn.addEventListener('click', () => {
    window.location.hash = '#earthquakes';
    updateActiveButton('#earthquakes');
  });


  function updateActiveButton(activeTab) {
    // Reset all buttons
    homepageBtn.style.display = 'flex';
    laPalmaBtn.style.display = 'flex';
    teideBtn.style.display = 'flex';
    lanzaroteBtn.style.display = 'flex';
    earthquakesBtn.style.display = 'flex';
    
    // Hide the active tab button
    switch(activeTab) {
      case '#homepage':
        homepageBtn.style.display = 'none';
        break;
      case '#la-palma':
        laPalmaBtn.style.display = 'none';
        break;
      case '#teide':
        teideBtn.style.display = 'none';
        break;
      case '#earthquakes':
        earthquakesBtn.style.display = 'none';
        break;
      case '#lanzarote':
        lanzaroteBtn.style.display = 'none';
        break;
    }
  }


  function handleHashChange() {
    const currentHash = window.location.hash || '#homepage';
    updateActiveButton(currentHash);
  }


  window.addEventListener('hashchange', handleHashChange);
  

  handleHashChange();

  document.body.setAttribute('data-has-circular-nav', 'true');
});
</script>

      <h3>Fire Radiative Power (FRP) Explanation</h3>
      <p>This graph displays the estimated daily Fire Radiative Power (FRP) over the volcano, derived from satellite-based brightness temperature (BT) measurements using the VIIRS sensor.</p>
      <p>For each day, the observed BT is compared to a monthly thermal reference (REF), representing the typical background temperature when there is no volcanic activity. Only valid pixels within the defined volcanic area are considered.</p>
      <p>The FRP for each pixel is calculated using the Stefan‚ÄìBoltzmann law:</p>
      <p class="formula">FRP = œÉ ¬∑ ((T<sub>obs</sub>)‚Å¥ - (T<sub>ref</sub>)‚Å¥) ¬∑ A</p>
      <p>where œÉ is the Stefan‚ÄìBoltzmann constant (5.67√ó10‚Åª‚Å∏ W¬∑m‚Åª¬≤¬∑K‚Åª‚Å¥), T<sub>obs</sub> is the observed brightness temperature (K), T<sub>ref</sub> is the reference temperature (K), and A is the area per pixel (140,625 m¬≤).</p>

<!-- Combined Analysis Section -->
<div class="context-box combined-analysis">
    <div class="context-title">Understanding the Thermal Activity Graphs</div>
    <div class="context-text">
        <p>This visualization shows the evolution of thermal energy emitted by the Tajogaite volcano following its eruption (September 19 ‚Äì December 13, 2021). The metric used is Radiative Power (FRP), which estimates the amount of thermal energy radiated into the atmosphere and is directly linked to surface volcanic activity (lava flows, hot gases, fumaroles, etc.).</p>
        
        <p>Immediately after the eruption, the volcanic terrain retains extremely high temperatures (e.g. incandescent lava, fresh flows), which results in high FRP values. However, in the following days, the volcanic system begins to cool rapidly due to:</p>
        
        <ul style="color: #555; line-height: 1.7; margin-bottom: 15px;">
            <li>The absence of new magma being emitted.</li>
            <li>Natural dissipation of heat into the atmosphere.</li>
            <li>Solidification and consolidation of volcanic material.</li>
        </ul>
        
        <p>Even though the volcano enters a dormant phase, fumaroles, persistent hot spots, and residual geochemical processes may continue to generate weaker but still detectable thermal signals for months or even years after the eruption.</p>
        
        <p style="color: #000; font-weight: 500;">This daily dataset is automatically updated every day using thermal observations provided by NASA's remote sensing servers.</p>
    </div>
</div>

            <div class="context-text">
                <p>The island of La Palma, experiences seismic activity related to regional tectonics. Between October 2017 and June 2021, eight similar seismic swarms were recorded in the southern part of the island.</p>
                
                <p>A 2021 scientific study using advanced satellite techniques detected anomalies in the subsurface of the Aridane Valley since 2009-2010, suggesting possible volcanic reactivation. However, the study itself noted that in 80% of cases with these types of signals, no eruptions occur.</p>
                
                <p>On September 11, 2021, a new low-intensity seismic swarm began. By Monday the 13th, about 1,500 seismic movements had been recorded, concentrated in the Cumbre Vieja Natural Park.</p>
                
                <p>On September 19, the day the eruption began, more than 300 earthquakes were detected, including one of magnitude 3.8 mbLg at shallow depth. Additionally, ground deformation of up to 15 cm was recorded due to magma pressure.</p>

<!-- Seismic Activity Visualization -->
<div class="context-box">
  <div class="context-title">Seismic Activity Visualization</div>
  <div class="context-text">
    <p>The USGS service does not register all seismic events in all regions of the world due to the various limitations this would entail.
    </p>
    <p>
      It has some regions of interest with more precise databases where a larger quantity of earthquakes can be found, but in other regions such as the Canary Islands, the USGS does not provide a complete catalog for all the swarms that occur, as mentioned before.
    </p>
    <p>

            credit: '¬© <a href="https://www.euronews.com" target="_blank">Euronews</a>'
        }
    ];

    const mainImage = document.getElementById('main-carousel-image');
    const photoCredits = document.getElementById('photo-credits');
    const dots = document.querySelectorAll('.dot');
    let currentIndex = 0;
    let intervalId;

    function updateCarousel(index) {

        mainImage.classList.add('fade-out');
        photoCredits.classList.add('fade-out');
        

        setTimeout(() => {

            mainImage.src = images[index].src;
            photoCredits.innerHTML = images[index].credit;
            

            mainImage.classList.remove('fade-out');
            photoCredits.classList.remove('fade-out');
            
            
            dots.forEach(dot => dot.classList.remove('active'));
            dots[index].classList.add('active');
            
            currentIndex = index;
        }, 300); 
    }

    
    dots.forEach(dot => {
        dot.addEventListener('click', () => {
            const index = parseInt(dot.getAttribute('data-index'));
            if (index !== currentIndex) {
                
                clearInterval(intervalId);
                updateCarousel(index);
                startAutoRotation();
            }
        });
    });

    
    function startAutoRotation() {
        intervalId = setInterval(() => {
            const nextIndex = (currentIndex + 1) % images.length;
            updateCarousel(nextIndex);
        }, 5000);
    }

    
    startAutoRotation();
});
</script>

      <div class="context-text">
        <p>There are several ways earthquakes affect volcanic activity. The main cases are those related to the dynamic and static stresses that they cause to the magmatic chambers. Although the event may also tear the chamber if the fault is large enough or if the hypocenter is close enough.</p>

        <p>These are not the only conditions to cause an eruptive period, there has to be a "predisposition" to ignite it. The main things are the material composition of the crust, the viscosity and density of the magma, the bubble flow, if there are temperature changes that affects to the (usually crystal) ceiling of the magmatic chamber...</p>

        <p>Statistically, closed system volcanoes are more likely to trigger due to seismic events than open volcanoes, existing a geological factor that affects to this statistic. Specifically, it is estimated that in Chile and Indonesia 25% of volcanoes are susceptible to earthquakes (Watt et al. 2009) while in other regions is estimated to be only 0.3-0.4% (Linde and Selwyn Sacks, 1998; Manga and Brodsky, 2006; Lemarchand and Grasso, 2007).</p>

        <p>Usually the time-span accepted to consider an earthquake the cause of an eruption is up to 5 years, due to the studied time-span of stabilization of the volcano after the different stress-caused mechanisms.     <p>The graph above illustrates the <strong>Daily Radiative Power (FRP)</strong> (MW) at Teide (Tenerife), revealing a generally low thermal output with a clear sinusoidal pattern. The FRP values oscillate between approximately <strong>20 MW</strong> and <strong>120 MW</strong>, displaying a cyclical behavior that repeats consistently each year. Notably, the peaks tend to occur every August, while the lowest values are observed during winter months, particularly around January and early February‚Äîindicating a seasonal dynamic with summer highs and winter lows.</p>

    <p>The dataset spans five years, from 2020 to 2025, which allows for the identification of five distinct summer peaks. As the cold season ends, a progressive increase in FRP is observed, which may be linked to rising ambient temperatures and their influence on the volcano's hydrothermal system.</p>

    <p>Additionally, several seismic swarms were recorded on Tenerife, including beneath Teide and the Pico Viejo complex in November 2024. However, when comparing thermal activity during those dates to other years, no significant anomaly or deviation is apparent in the FRP pattern. Therefore, based on these data alone, no clear correlation can be established between the seismic activity and changes in Teide‚Äôs hydrothermal output.</p>

<script>
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
    // Teide Carrusel
    const teideImages = [
        {
            src: "https://cdn.diariodeavisos.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/RS621621_sm-teide-fumarolas.jpg",
            credit: '¬© <a href="https://www.diariodeavisos.com" target="_blank">Diario de Avisos</a>',
            alt: "Fumarolas del Teide"
        },
        {
            src: "https://pellagofio.es/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/chinyero-12624-1-780x470.jpg",
            credit: '¬© <a href="https://pellagofio.es" target="_blank">Pellagofio</a>',
            alt: "Volc√°n Chinyero en Tenerife"
        },
        {
            src: "https://estaticos-cdn.prensaiberica.es/clip/c0eb680d-772c-4096-97bb-ba210f1c2fce_16-9-discover-aspect-ratio_default_0.webp",
            credit: '¬© <a href="https://www.prensaiberica.es" target="_blank">Prensa Ib√©rica</a>',
            alt: "Vista a√©rea del Teide"
        },
        {
            src: "https://cdn.diariodeavisos.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Observatorio-Teide-Izana-1024x597.jpg",
            credit: '¬© <a href="https://www.iac.es" target="_blank">Instituto de Astrof√≠sica de Canarias</a>',
            alt: "Observatorios del Teide"
        },
        {
            src: "https://www.elperiodicodeycodendaute.es/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/crater-teide2.jpg",
            credit: '¬© <a href="https://www.elperiodicodeycodendaute.es" target="_blank">El Peri√≥dico de Ycoden Daute</a>',
            alt: "Cr√°ter del Teide"
        },
        {
            src: "https://mirametv.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/teide-2-1024x640.jpg",
            credit: '¬© <a href="https://mirametv.com" target="_blank">Mirame TV</a>',
            alt: "Atardecer en el Teide"
        }
    ];


    const teideMainImage = document.getElementById('teide-main-image');
    const teidePhotoCredits = document.getElementById('teide-photo-credits');
    const teideDots = document.querySelectorAll('.teide-carousel .dot');
   
    if (!teideMainImage || !teidePhotoCredits || teideDots.length === 0) {
        console.error('No se encontraron elementos esenciales del carrusel del Teide');
        return;
    }


    let teideCurrentIndex = 0;
    let teideIntervalId;


    function updateTeideCarousel(index) {
        // Validate index
        if (index < 0 || index >= teideImages.length) return;
       
        //  fade-out
        teideMainImage.classList.add('fade-out');
        teidePhotoCredits.classList.add('fade-out');
       
        setTimeout(() => {
            // Change content
            teideMainImage.src = teideImages[index].src;
            teideMainImage.alt = teideImages[index].alt;
            teidePhotoCredits.innerHTML = teideImages[index].credit;
           
            // off fade-out
            teideMainImage.classList.remove('fade-out');
            teidePhotoCredits.classList.remove('fade-out');
           

            teideDots.forEach(dot => dot.classList.remove('active'));
            teideDots[index].classList.add('active');
           
            teideCurrentIndex = index;
        }, 300);
    }



    teideDots.forEach(dot => {
        dot.addEventListener('click', function() {
            const index = parseInt(this.getAttribute('data-index'));
            if (!isNaN(index)) {
                clearInterval(teideIntervalId);
                updateTeideCarousel(index);
                startTeideAutoRotation();
            }
        });
    });


    function startTeideAutoRotation() {
        clearInterval(teideIntervalId); 
        teideIntervalId = setInterval(() => {
            const nextIndex = (teideCurrentIndex + 1) % teideImages.length;
            updateTeideCarousel(nextIndex);
        }, 5000);
    }



    startTeideAutoRotation();



    const teideCarousel = document.querySelector('.teide-carousel');
    if (teideCarousel) {
        teideCarousel.addEventListener('mouseenter', () => {
            clearInterval(teideIntervalId);
        });
       
        teideCarousel.addEventListener('mouseleave', () => {
            startTeideAutoRotation();
        });
    }
});
</script>

<script>

function toggleInfo(id) {

  document.querySelectorAll('.info-popup').forEach(popup => {
    if (popup.id !== id) popup.style.display = 'none';
  });
  

  const popup = document.getElementById(id);
  popup.style.display = popup.style.display === 'block' ? 'none' : 'block';
}


document.addEventListener('click', function(e) {
  if (!e.target.closest('.info-button') && !e.target.closest('.info-popup')) {
    document.querySelectorAll('.info-popup').forEach(popup => {
      popup.style.display = 'none';
    });
  }
});


function changeLanzaroteRefImage() {
  const selector = document.getElementById("monthSelectLanzarote");
  const image = document.getElementById("lanzaroteRefImage");
  if (selector && image) {
    image.src = selector.value;
  }
}
</script>

<script>
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {

    const lanzaroteImages = [
        {
            src: "https://es.lowcosttourslanzarote.com/templateEditor/kcfinder/upload/images/Timanfaya%20geiser%2002_LR.jpg",
            credit: '¬© <a href="https://es.lowcosttourslanzarote.com/blog/imprescendibles-lanzarote/1-parque-nacional-de-timanfaya" target="_blank">LCT Europe</a>'
        },
        {
            src: "https://es.lowcosttourslanzarote.com/templateEditor/kcfinder/upload/images/MONTA%C3%91AS%20DEL%20FUEGO_LR.jpg",
            credit: '¬© <a href="https://es.lowcosttourslanzarote.com/blog/imprescendibles-lanzarote/1-parque-nacional-de-timanfaya" target="_blank">LCT Europe</a>'
        },
        {
            src: "https://estaticos-cdn.prensaiberica.es/clip/825fb726-1b75-45a8-91db-a130023f0d46_16-9-aspect-ratio_default_0.webp",
            credit: '¬© <a href="https://www.laprovincia.es/sociedad/2017/08/10/timanfaya-escudo-volcanes-vivos-9654196.html" target="_blank">La Provincia</a>'
        },
        {
            src: "https://calimasurf.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/1619526186-timanfaya-lanzarote.jpg",
            credit: '¬© <a href="https://calimasurf.com/es/noticias/parque-nacional-de-timanfaya-lanzarote" target="_blank">Calima Surf</a>'
        }
    ];





    const lanzaroteMainImage = document.getElementById('lanzarote-main-image');
    const lanzarotePhotoCredits = document.getElementById('lanzarote-photo-credits');
    const lanzaroteDots = document.querySelectorAll('.lanzarote-carousel .dot');
   
    if (!lanzaroteMainImage || !lanzarotePhotoCredits || lanzaroteDots.length === 0) {
        console.error('No se encontraron elementos esenciales del carrusel del Teide');
        return;
    }




    let lanzaroteCurrentIndex = 0;
    let lanzaroteIntervalId;




    function updateLanzaroteCarousel(index) {

        if (index < 0 || index >= lanzaroteImages.length) return;
       

        lanzaroteMainImage.classList.add('fade-out');
        lanzarotePhotoCredits.classList.add('fade-out');
       
        setTimeout(() => {

            lanzaroteMainImage.src = lanzaroteImages[index].src;
            lanzaroteMainImage.alt = lanzaroteImages[index].alt;
            lanzarotePhotoCredits.innerHTML = lanzaroteImages[index].credit;
           

            lanzaroteMainImage.classList.remove('fade-out');
            lanzarotePhotoCredits.classList.remove('fade-out');
           

            lanzaroteDots.forEach(dot => dot.classList.remove('active'));
            lanzaroteDots[index].classList.add('active');
           
            lanzaroteCurrentIndex = index;
        }, 300);
    }





    lanzaroteDots.forEach(dot => {
        dot.addEventListener('click', function() {
            const index = parseInt(this.getAttribute('data-index'));
            if (!isNaN(index)) {
                clearInterval(lanzaroteIntervalId);
                updateLanzaroteCarousel(index);
                startLanzaroteAutoRotation();
            }
        });
    });




    function startLanzaroteAutoRotation() {
        clearInterval(lanzaroteIntervalId); 
        lanzaroteIntervalId = setInterval(() => {
            const nextIndex = (lanzaroteCurrentIndex + 1) % lanzaroteImages.length;
            updateLanzaroteCarousel(nextIndex);
        }, 5000);
    }





    startLanzaroteAutoRotation();





    const lanzaroteCarousel = document.querySelector('.lanzarote-carousel');
    if (lanzaroteCarousel) {
        lanzaroteCarousel.addEventListener('mouseenter', () => {
            clearInterval(lanzaroteIntervalId);
        });
       
        lanzaroteCarousel.addEventListener('mouseleave', () => {
            startLanzaroteAutoRotation();
        });
    }
});
</script>
